newsitem.title: USA: Healthcare premiums up less than inflation - study.
newsitem.headline: Healthcare premiums up less than inflation - study.

text.p: KPMG Peat Marwick LLP said Wednesday its Compensation and Benefits Practice released a national survey that showed U.S. health care premiums rose 2.1 percent during the past year, less than the rate of inflation.

The company said the annual survey, its seventh, marks the third consecutive year premium increases were less than the overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Consumer Price Index and growth in workers' earnings.
But, KPMG said, 1998 premium increases may again surpass inflation as health maintenance organizations and insurers seek to make up for underwriting losses incurred last year.
